config.text: How can driving in a fuel-efficient manner help protect the environment?

choices.label: Through the legal enforcement of speed regulations
By increasing the number of cars on the road

correct.text: Fuel-efficient driving is all about looking and planning further ahead. This helps raise your hazard awareness and reduces the need for late and heavy braking. This will make your journeys more comfortable, as well as considerably reducing your fuel bills and reducing emissions that can damage the environment.

incorrect.text: Fuel-efficient driving is all about looking and planning further ahead. This helps raise your hazard awareness and reduces the need for late and heavy braking. This will make your journeys more comfortable, as well as considerably reducing your fuel bills and reducing emissions that can damage the environment.

config.text: What will reduce fuel consumption?

correct.text:
Harsh braking, frequent gear changes and harsh acceleration increase fuel consumption. A car uses less fuel when travelling at a constant low speed in an appropriate high gear.
You need to look well ahead so you’re able to anticipate hazards early. Easing off the accelerator and timing your approach at junctions, for example, can reduce the fuel consumption of your vehicle.

incorrect.text:
Harsh braking, frequent gear changes and harsh acceleration increase fuel consumption. A car uses less fuel when travelling at a constant low speed in an appropriate high gear.
You need to look well ahead so you’re able to anticipate hazards early. Easing off the accelerator and timing your approach at junctions, for example, can reduce the fuel consumption of your vehicle.

config.text: How should you drive when you're driving along a road that has road humps?

choices.label: Always keep to the maximum legal speed
Drive slowly at school times only

correct.text: Road humps are there for a reason – to protect vulnerable road users by reducing the speed of traffic. Don’t accelerate harshly between the humps. Put the safety of others first and maintain a reduced speed throughout the zone.

incorrect.text: Road humps are there for a reason – to protect vulnerable road users by reducing the speed of traffic. Don’t accelerate harshly between the humps. Put the safety of others first and maintain a reduced speed throughout the zone.

config.text: When should you check the engine oil level?

choices.label: Every time you drive the car

correct.text:
An engine can use more oil during long journeys than on shorter trips. Insufficient engine oil is potentially dangerous: it can lead to excessive wear, mechanical breakdown and expensive repairs.
Most cars have a dipstick to allow the oil level to be checked. If not, you should refer to the vehicle handbook.

incorrect.text:
An engine can use more oil during long journeys than on shorter trips. Insufficient engine oil is potentially dangerous: it can lead to excessive wear, mechanical breakdown and expensive repairs.
Most cars have a dipstick to allow the oil level to be checked. If not, you should refer to the vehicle handbook.

config.text: What's likely to happen if you put too much oil in your engine?

choices.label: The air intake will become blocked

correct.text: Too much oil will lead to increased pressure in the engine. This could damage oil seals and lead to oil leaks. Any excess oil should be drained off.

incorrect.text: Too much oil will lead to increased pressure in the engine. This could damage oil seals and lead to oil leaks. Any excess oil should be drained off.

config.text: How much more fuel will you use by driving at 70 mph, compared with driving at 50 mph?

correct.text: Your vehicle will use less fuel if you avoid heavy acceleration. The higher the engine revs, the more fuel you'll use. Using the same gear, and covering the same distance, a vehicle travelling at 70 mph will use about 15% more fuel than it would at 50 mph. However, don’t travel so slowly that you inconvenience or endanger other road users.

incorrect.text: Your vehicle will use less fuel if you avoid heavy acceleration. The higher the engine revs, the more fuel you'll use. Using the same gear, and covering the same distance, a vehicle travelling at 70 mph will use about 15% more fuel than it would at 50 mph. However, don’t travel so slowly that you inconvenience or endanger other road users.

config.text: How will your journey be affected by travelling outside the busy times of day?

choices.label: Your journey will use more fuel
Your journey will be more hazardous
Your journey will have fewer delays

correct.text: If possible, avoid the early morning, late afternoon and early evening ‘rush hour’. Doing this should allow you to have a better journey, with fewer delays. This should help you to arrive at your destination feeling less stressed.

incorrect.text: If possible, avoid the early morning, late afternoon and early evening ‘rush hour’. Doing this should allow you to have a better journey, with fewer delays. This should help you to arrive at your destination feeling less stressed.

config.text: When is fuel consumption at its highest?

correct.text: Accelerating uses a lot of fuel, so always try to use the accelerator smoothly. Taking your foot off the accelerator allows the momentum of the car to take you forward, especially when going downhill. This can save a considerable amount of fuel without any loss of control over the vehicle.

incorrect.text: Accelerating uses a lot of fuel, so always try to use the accelerator smoothly. Taking your foot off the accelerator allows the momentum of the car to take you forward, especially when going downhill. This can save a considerable amount of fuel without any loss of control over the vehicle.

config.text: You're having difficulty finding a parking space in a busy town. Can you park on the zigzag lines of a zebra crossing?

choices.label: No, not unless you stay with your car
Yes, in order to drop off a passenger
Yes, if you don't block people from crossing

correct.text: It’s an offence to park on the zigzag lines of a zebra crossing. You'll be causing an obstruction by obscuring the view of both pedestrians and drivers.

incorrect.text: It’s an offence to park on the zigzag lines of a zebra crossing. You'll be causing an obstruction by obscuring the view of both pedestrians and drivers.

config.text: When may a passenger travel in a car without wearing a seat belt?

choices.label: When they're under 1.5 metres (5 feet) in height
When they're sitting in the rear seat
When they're exempt for medical reasons

correct.text: If you have adult passengers, it's their responsibility to wear a seat belt, but you should still remind them to use one as they get in the car. It's your responsibility to make sure that all children in your car are secured with an appropriate restraint. Exemptions are allowed for those with a medical exemption certificate.

incorrect.text: If you have adult passengers, it's their responsibility to wear a seat belt, but you should still remind them to use one as they get in the car. It's your responsibility to make sure that all children in your car are secured with an appropriate restraint. Exemptions are allowed for those with a medical exemption certificate.

config.text: What's the purpose of a catalytic converter?

choices.label: To reduce the risk of fire

correct.text: Catalytic converters reduce a large percentage of harmful exhaust emissions. They work more efficiently when the engine has reached its normal working temperature.

incorrect.text: Catalytic converters reduce a large percentage of harmful exhaust emissions. They work more efficiently when the engine has reached its normal working temperature.

config.text: You're leaving your vehicle parked on a road and unattended. When may you leave the engine running?

choices.label: If you'll be parking for less than five minutes
If the battery keeps going flat
When parked in a 20 mph zone
Never if you're away from the vehicle

correct.text: When you leave your vehicle parked on a road, switch off the engine and secure the vehicle. Make sure no valuables are visible, shut all the windows, lock the vehicle, and set the alarm if the vehicle has one.

incorrect.text: When you leave your vehicle parked on a road, switch off the engine and secure the vehicle. Make sure no valuables are visible, shut all the windows, lock the vehicle, and set the alarm if the vehicle has one.

config.text: You're driving a friend's children home from school. They're both under 14 years old. Who's responsible for making sure they wear a seat belt or approved child restraint where required?

correct.text: Passengers should always be secured and safe. Children should be encouraged to fasten their seat belts or approved restraints themselves from an early age, so that it becomes a matter of routine. As the driver, you must check that they're fastened securely. It's your responsibility.

incorrect.text: Passengers should always be secured and safe. Children should be encouraged to fasten their seat belts or approved restraints themselves from an early age, so that it becomes a matter of routine. As the driver, you must check that they're fastened securely. It's your responsibility.

config.text: How can you reduce the chances of your car being broken into when leaving it unattended?

choices.label: Place any valuables on the floor

correct.text: When leaving your car, take all valuables with you if you can. Otherwise, lock them out of sight.

incorrect.text: When leaving your car, take all valuables with you if you can. Otherwise, lock them out of sight.

config.text: How can you reduce the risk of your vehicle being broken into at night?

choices.label: Leave it in a well-lit area
Park in a quiet side road
Park in a poorly lit area

correct.text: Having your vehicle broken into or stolen can be very distressing and inconvenient. Avoid leaving your vehicle unattended in poorly lit areas.

incorrect.text: Having your vehicle broken into or stolen can be very distressing and inconvenient. Avoid leaving your vehicle unattended in poorly lit areas.

config.text: Why should you try and park in a secure car park?

choices.label: It makes it easy to find your car
It stops the car being exposed to bad weather
It doesn't cost anything to park here

correct.text: Whenever possible, leave your car in a secure car park. This will help deter thieves.

incorrect.text: Whenever possible, leave your car in a secure car park. This will help deter thieves.

config.text: What should you do if your vehicle pulls to one side when you use the brakes?

choices.label: Increase the pressure in your tyres
Have the brakes checked as soon as possible
Change gear and pump the brake pedal
Use your parking brake at the same time

correct.text: The brakes on your vehicle must be effective and properly adjusted. If your vehicle pulls to one side when braking, take it to be checked by a qualified mechanic as soon as you can.

incorrect.text: The brakes on your vehicle must be effective and properly adjusted. If your vehicle pulls to one side when braking, take it to be checked by a qualified mechanic as soon as you can.

config.text: How should you dispose of a used vehicle battery?

choices.label: Take it to a local-authority disposal site

correct.text: Batteries contain acid, which is hazardous, and they must be disposed of safely. This means taking them to an appropriate disposal site.

incorrect.text: Batteries contain acid, which is hazardous, and they must be disposed of safely. This means taking them to an appropriate disposal site.

config.text: What could you do to reduce the volume of traffic on the roads?

choices.label: Use a car with a smaller engine
Walk or cycle on short journeys
Travel by car at all times

correct.text: Try not to use your car as a matter of routine. For shorter journeys, consider walking or cycling instead - this is much better for both you and the environment.

incorrect.text: Try not to use your car as a matter of routine. For shorter journeys, consider walking or cycling instead - this is much better for both you and the environment.

config.text: What should you do when leaving your vehicle parked and unattended?

choices.label: Lock it and remove the key

correct.text: An unlocked car is an open invitation to thieves. Leaving the keys in the ignition not only makes your car easy to steal but could also invalidate your insurance.

incorrect.text: An unlocked car is an open invitation to thieves. Leaving the keys in the ignition not only makes your car easy to steal but could also invalidate your insurance.

config.text: You service your own vehicle. How should you dispose of the old engine oil?

choices.label: Take it to a local-authority site
Tip it into a hole in the ground

correct.text: It's illegal to pour engine oil down any drain. Oil is a pollutant and harmful to wildlife. Dispose of it safely at an authorised site.

incorrect.text: It's illegal to pour engine oil down any drain. Oil is a pollutant and harmful to wildlife. Dispose of it safely at an authorised site.

config.text: You're carrying two 13-year-old children and their parents in your car. Who's responsible for seeing that the children wear seat belts?

correct.text: Seat belts save lives and reduce the risk of injury. If you're carrying passengers under 14 years old, it's your responsibility as the driver to ensure that their seat belts are fastened or they're seated in an approved child restraint.

incorrect.text: Seat belts save lives and reduce the risk of injury. If you're carrying passengers under 14 years old, it's your responsibility as the driver to ensure that their seat belts are fastened or they're seated in an approved child restraint.

config.text: The fluid level in your battery is low. What fluid should you use to top it up?

correct.text: Some modern batteries are maintenance free. Check your vehicle handbook and, if necessary, make sure that the plates in each battery cell are covered with fluid.

incorrect.text: Some modern batteries are maintenance free. Check your vehicle handbook and, if necessary, make sure that the plates in each battery cell are covered with fluid.

config.text: What will help you to keep your car secure?

choices.label: Being a member of a vehicle breakdown organisation
Registering with a Vehicle Watch scheme

correct.text: The Vehicle Watch scheme helps to reduce the risk of your car being stolen. By displaying high-visibility Vehicle Watch stickers in your car, you're inviting the police to stop your vehicle if it's seen in use between midnight and 5 am.

incorrect.text: The Vehicle Watch scheme helps to reduce the risk of your car being stolen. By displaying high-visibility Vehicle Watch stickers in your car, you're inviting the police to stop your vehicle if it's seen in use between midnight and 5 am.

config.text: What does fuel-efficient driving achieve?

correct.text: The emphasis is on hazard awareness and planning ahead. By looking well ahead, you'll have plenty of time to deal with hazards safely and won’t need to brake sharply. This will also reduce damage to the environment.

incorrect.text: The emphasis is on hazard awareness and planning ahead. By looking well ahead, you'll have plenty of time to deal with hazards safely and won’t need to brake sharply. This will also reduce damage to the environment.

config.text: You're carrying an 11-year-old child on the front seat of your car. They're under 1.35 metres (4 feet 5 inches) tall. What seat belt security must be in place?

choices.label: They must use an adult seat belt
They must be able to fasten their own seat belt
They must use a suitable child restraint
They must be able to see clearly out of the front window

correct.text: As the driver, it's your responsibility to make sure that children are secure and safe in your vehicle. Make yourself familiar with the rules. When children are carried on the back seat, there are a few very exceptional cases when an adult seat belt can be used instead of a correct child restraint.

incorrect.text: As the driver, it's your responsibility to make sure that children are secure and safe in your vehicle. Make yourself familiar with the rules. When children are carried on the back seat, there are a few very exceptional cases when an adult seat belt can be used instead of a correct child restraint.

config.text: What does it mean if this light comes on while you're driving?

choices.label: A fault in the braking system

correct.text: If this light comes on, you should have the brake system checked immediately. A faulty braking system could have dangerous consequences.

incorrect.text: If this light comes on, you should have the brake system checked immediately. A faulty braking system could have dangerous consequences.

config.text: What's most likely to waste fuel?

correct.text: Wasting fuel costs you money and also causes unnecessary pollution. Ensuring your tyres are correctly inflated, avoiding carrying unnecessary weight and removing a roof rack that's not in use will all help to reduce your fuel consumption.

incorrect.text: Wasting fuel costs you money and also causes unnecessary pollution. Ensuring your tyres are correctly inflated, avoiding carrying unnecessary weight and removing a roof rack that's not in use will all help to reduce your fuel consumption.

config.text: What's most likely to increase fuel consumption?

correct.text: Accelerating and braking gently and smoothly will help to save fuel and reduce wear on your vehicle. This makes it better for the environment too.

incorrect.text: Accelerating and braking gently and smoothly will help to save fuel and reduce wear on your vehicle. This makes it better for the environment too.

config.text: What's the most important reason for having a properly adjusted head restraint?

choices.label: To help you avoid neck injury
To help you maintain your driving position

correct.text: In a collision, rapid deceleration will violently throw vehicle occupants forward and then backwards as the vehicle stops. Seat belts and airbags protect occupants against the forward movement. Head restraints should be adjusted so they give maximum protection to the head and neck during the backward movement.

incorrect.text: In a collision, rapid deceleration will violently throw vehicle occupants forward and then backwards as the vehicle stops. Seat belts and airbags protect occupants against the forward movement. Head restraints should be adjusted so they give maximum protection to the head and neck during the backward movement.

config.text: You need to top up your battery with distilled water. What level should you fill it to?

correct.text: Top up the battery with distilled water and make sure each cell plate is covered.

incorrect.text: Top up the battery with distilled water and make sure each cell plate is covered.

config.text: What should you do if your anti-lock brakes (ABS) warning light stays on?

choices.label: Check that the parking brake is released

correct.text: Consult the vehicle handbook or a garage before driving the vehicle any further. Only drive to a garage if it's safe to do so. If you aren't sure, get expert help.

incorrect.text: Consult the vehicle handbook or a garage before driving the vehicle any further. Only drive to a garage if it's safe to do so. If you aren't sure, get expert help.

config.text: On a vehicle, where would you find a catalytic converter?

correct.text: Although carbon dioxide is still produced, a catalytic converter fitted to the exhaust system reduces the toxic and polluting gases by up to 90%.

incorrect.text: Although carbon dioxide is still produced, a catalytic converter fitted to the exhaust system reduces the toxic and polluting gases by up to 90%.

config.text: You want to put a rear-facing baby seat on the front passenger seat. What must you do if the passenger seat is protected by a frontal airbag?

choices.label: Turn the seat to face sideways
Ask a passenger to hold the baby
Put the child in an adult seat belt

correct.text: It's illegal to fit a rear-facing baby seat into a passenger seat protected by an active frontal airbag. If the airbag activates, it could cause serious injury or even death to the child. You must secure it in a different seat or deactivate the relevant airbag. Follow the manufacturer's advice when fitting a baby seat.

incorrect.text: It's illegal to fit a rear-facing baby seat into a passenger seat protected by an active frontal airbag. If the airbag activates, it could cause serious injury or even death to the child. You must secure it in a different seat or deactivate the relevant airbag. Follow the manufacturer's advice when fitting a baby seat.

config.text: What can cause excessive or uneven tyre wear?

correct.text: If you see that parts of the tread on your tyres are wearing before others, it may indicate a brake, suspension or wheel-alignment fault. Regular servicing will help to detect faults at an early stage and this will avoid the risk of minor faults becoming serious or even dangerous.

incorrect.text: If you see that parts of the tread on your tyres are wearing before others, it may indicate a brake, suspension or wheel-alignment fault. Regular servicing will help to detect faults at an early stage and this will avoid the risk of minor faults becoming serious or even dangerous.

config.text: How will you benefit from following the manufacturer's service schedule for your vehicle?

choices.label: Your vehicle will be cheaper to insure
Your vehicle tax will be lower
Your journey times will be reduced

correct.text: All vehicles need to be serviced to keep working efficiently. An efficient engine uses less fuel and produces fewer harmful emissions than an engine that's running inefficiently. Keeping the vehicle serviced to the manufacturer's schedule should also keep it reliable and reduce the chance of it breaking down.

incorrect.text: All vehicles need to be serviced to keep working efficiently. An efficient engine uses less fuel and produces fewer harmful emissions than an engine that's running inefficiently. Keeping the vehicle serviced to the manufacturer's schedule should also keep it reliable and reduce the chance of it breaking down.

config.text: When will your vehicle use more fuel?

choices.label: When its tyres are of different makes

correct.text: Check your tyre pressures frequently - normally once a week. If they're lower than those recommended by the manufacturer, there will be more 'rolling resistance'. The engine will have to work harder to overcome this, leading to increased fuel consumption.

incorrect.text: Check your tyre pressures frequently - normally once a week. If they're lower than those recommended by the manufacturer, there will be more 'rolling resistance'. The engine will have to work harder to overcome this, leading to increased fuel consumption.

config.text: What can you do to reduce environmental damage caused by your vehicle?

choices.label: Use the air conditioning whenever you drive
Use the gears to slow the vehicle
Avoid making a lot of short journeys

correct.text: Avoid using your car for short journeys. On a short journey, the engine is unlikely to warm up fully and will therefore be running less efficiently. This will result in the car using more fuel and emitting higher levels of harmful emissions.

incorrect.text: Avoid using your car for short journeys. On a short journey, the engine is unlikely to warm up fully and will therefore be running less efficiently. This will result in the car using more fuel and emitting higher levels of harmful emissions.

config.text: How can you reduce the environmental harm caused by your motor vehicle?

choices.label: Only use it for short journeys

correct.text: Engines that burn fossil fuels produce exhaust emissions that are harmful to health. The harder you make the engine work, the more emissions it will produce. Engines also use more fuel and produce higher levels of emissions when they're cold. Anything you can do to reduce your use of fossil fuels will help the environment.

incorrect.text: Engines that burn fossil fuels produce exhaust emissions that are harmful to health. The harder you make the engine work, the more emissions it will produce. Engines also use more fuel and produce higher levels of emissions when they're cold. Anything you can do to reduce your use of fossil fuels will help the environment.

config.text: Why do MOT tests include an exhaust emission test?

choices.label: To recover the cost of expensive garage equipment
To help protect the environment against pollution
To discover which fuel supplier is used the most
To make sure diesel and petrol engines emit the same fumes

correct.text: Emission tests are carried out to make sure your vehicle’s engine is operating efficiently. This ensures the pollution produced by the engine is kept to a minimum. If your vehicle isn't serviced regularly, it may fail the MOT emissions test.

incorrect.text: Emission tests are carried out to make sure your vehicle’s engine is operating efficiently. This ensures the pollution produced by the engine is kept to a minimum. If your vehicle isn't serviced regularly, it may fail the MOT emissions test.

config.text: What does it mean if your vehicle keeps bouncing after you sharply press down and release on the bodywork over a wheel?

choices.label: The vehicle is on soft ground

correct.text: If you find that your vehicle bounces as you drive around a corner or bend in the road, the shock absorbers might be worn. To test your shock absorbers, sharply press down and release above each wheel. If the vehicle continues to bounce, take it to be checked by a qualified mechanic.

incorrect.text: If you find that your vehicle bounces as you drive around a corner or bend in the road, the shock absorbers might be worn. To test your shock absorbers, sharply press down and release above each wheel. If the vehicle continues to bounce, take it to be checked by a qualified mechanic.

config.text: How would under-inflated tyres affect your vehicle?

choices.label: The vehicle's stopping distance would increase
The flash rate of the vehicle's indicators would increase
The vehicle's gear change mechanism would become stiff
The vehicle's headlights would aim high

correct.text: Your tyres are your only contact with the road. To prevent problems with braking and steering, keep your tyres free from defects; they must have sufficient tread depth and be correctly inflated. Correct tyre pressures help reduce the risk of skidding and provide a safer and more comfortable drive or ride.

incorrect.text: Your tyres are your only contact with the road. To prevent problems with braking and steering, keep your tyres free from defects; they must have sufficient tread depth and be correctly inflated. Correct tyre pressures help reduce the risk of skidding and provide a safer and more comfortable drive or ride.

config.text: When are you not allowed to sound your vehicle's horn?

choices.label: Between 10.00 pm and 6.00 am in a built-up area
At any time in a built-up area
Between 11.30 pm and 7.00 am in a built-up area
Between 11.30 pm and 6.00 am on any road

correct.text: Every effort must be made to prevent excessive noise, especially in built-up areas at night. Don’t rev your engine or sound the horn unnecessarily. It's illegal to sound your horn in a built-up area between 11.30 pm and 7.00 am, except when another road user poses a danger.

incorrect.text: Every effort must be made to prevent excessive noise, especially in built-up areas at night. Don’t rev your engine or sound the horn unnecessarily. It's illegal to sound your horn in a built-up area between 11.30 pm and 7.00 am, except when another road user poses a danger.

config.text: How will a roof rack affect your car?

choices.label: There will be less wind noise
The engine will use more oil

correct.text: A roof rack increases your car's wind resistance. This will cause an increase in fuel consumption, so you should remove it when it isn't being used. An aerodynamically designed roof rack or box will help reduce wind resistance to a minimum, but the rack or box should still be removed when it isn't in use.

incorrect.text: A roof rack increases your car's wind resistance. This will cause an increase in fuel consumption, so you should remove it when it isn't being used. An aerodynamically designed roof rack or box will help reduce wind resistance to a minimum, but the rack or box should still be removed when it isn't in use.

config.text: What may help to deter a thief from stealing your car?

choices.label: Always keeping the interior light on
Etching the registration number on the windows

correct.text: Having your car registration number etched on all your windows is a cheap and effective way to deter professional car thieves.

incorrect.text: Having your car registration number etched on all your windows is a cheap and effective way to deter professional car thieves.

config.text: What will happen if your car's wheels are unbalanced?

choices.label: The steering will pull to one side

correct.text: If your wheels are out of balance, it will cause the steering to vibrate at certain speeds. This isn't a fault that will put itself right, so take your vehicle to a garage or tyre fitter to have the wheels rebalanced.

incorrect.text: If your wheels are out of balance, it will cause the steering to vibrate at certain speeds. This isn't a fault that will put itself right, so take your vehicle to a garage or tyre fitter to have the wheels rebalanced.

config.text: You plan your route before starting a journey. Why should you also plan an alternative route?

choices.label: Your original route may be blocked
Your maps may have different scales
You may find you have to pay a congestion charge
You may get held up by a tractor

correct.text: It can be frustrating and worrying to find your planned route is blocked by roadworks or diversions. If you've planned an alternative, you'll feel less stressed and more able to concentrate fully on your driving or riding. If your original route is mostly on motorways, it’s a good idea to plan an alternative using non-motorway roads. Always carry a map with you just in case you need to refer to it.

incorrect.text: It can be frustrating and worrying to find your planned route is blocked by roadworks or diversions. If you've planned an alternative, you'll feel less stressed and more able to concentrate fully on your driving or riding. If your original route is mostly on motorways, it’s a good idea to plan an alternative using non-motorway roads. Always carry a map with you just in case you need to refer to it.

config.text: You're parked on the road at night. When must you use parking lights?

choices.label: When there are continuous white lines in the middle of the road
When the speed limit exceeds 30 mph
When you're near a bus stop

correct.text: When parking at night, park in the direction of the traffic. This will enable other road users to see the reflectors on the rear of your vehicle. Use your parking lights if the speed limit is over 30 mph.

incorrect.text: When parking at night, park in the direction of the traffic. This will enable other road users to see the reflectors on the rear of your vehicle. Use your parking lights if the speed limit is over 30 mph.

config.text: How can you help to prevent your car radio being stolen?

correct.text: A security-coded radio can deter thieves, as it's likely to be of little use when removed from the vehicle.

incorrect.text: A security-coded radio can deter thieves, as it's likely to be of little use when removed from the vehicle.

config.text: You have to make an unexpected journey. You're carrying a five-year-old child on the back seat of your car. They're under 1.35 metres (4 feet 5 inches) tall. How should you seat them if a correct child restraint isn't available?

choices.label: Sharing a belt with an adult

correct.text: In journeys of unexpected necessity, and when a correct child restraint isn't available, the child must sit on the rear seat and use an adult seat belt. In a collision, unrestrained objects and people can cause serious injury or even death.

incorrect.text: In journeys of unexpected necessity, and when a correct child restraint isn't available, the child must sit on the rear seat and use an adult seat belt. In a collision, unrestrained objects and people can cause serious injury or even death.

config.text: What's the safest thing to do if you have to leave valuables in your car?

choices.label: Put them in a carrier bag

correct.text: If you have to leave valuables in your car, lock them out of sight. This is the best way to deter an opportunist thief.

incorrect.text: If you have to leave valuables in your car, lock them out of sight. This is the best way to deter an opportunist thief.

config.text: What could cause you to crash if the level is allowed to get too low?

correct.text: You should carry out frequent checks on all fluid levels but particularly brake fluid. As the brake pads or shoes wear down, the brake-fluid level will drop. If it drops below the minimum mark on the fluid reservoir, air could enter the hydraulic system and lead to a loss of braking efficiency or even complete brake failure.

incorrect.text: You should carry out frequent checks on all fluid levels but particularly brake fluid. As the brake pads or shoes wear down, the brake-fluid level will drop. If it drops below the minimum mark on the fluid reservoir, air could enter the hydraulic system and lead to a loss of braking efficiency or even complete brake failure.

config.text: What's the legal minimum tread depth for tyres on your trailer or caravan?

correct.text: Trailers and caravans may be left in storage over the winter months, and tyres can deteriorate. It's important to check their tread depth and also their pressures and general condition. The legal tread depth of 1.6 mm applies to the central three-quarters of a tyre's breadth, over its entire circumference.

incorrect.text: Trailers and caravans may be left in storage over the winter months, and tyres can deteriorate. It's important to check their tread depth and also their pressures and general condition. The legal tread depth of 1.6 mm applies to the central three-quarters of a tyre's breadth, over its entire circumference.

config.text: What can people who live or work in towns and cities do to help reduce urban pollution levels?

correct.text: Using a vehicle for short journeys means the engine doesn't have time to reach its normal operating temperature. When an engine is running below its normal operating temperature, it produces increased amounts of pollution. Walking and cycling don't create pollution and have health benefits as well.

incorrect.text: Using a vehicle for short journeys means the engine doesn't have time to reach its normal operating temperature. When an engine is running below its normal operating temperature, it produces increased amounts of pollution. Walking and cycling don't create pollution and have health benefits as well.

config.text: You have to arrive on time for an appointment. How should you plan for the journey?

choices.label: Allow plenty of time for the trip
Plan to travel at busy times
Avoid roads with the national speed limit

correct.text: Always allow plenty of time for your journey in case of unforeseen problems. Anything can happen; for example, punctures, breakdowns, road closures, diversions and delays. You'll feel less stressed and less inclined to take risks if you aren't ‘pushed for time’.

incorrect.text: Always allow plenty of time for your journey in case of unforeseen problems. Anything can happen; for example, punctures, breakdowns, road closures, diversions and delays. You'll feel less stressed and less inclined to take risks if you aren't ‘pushed for time’.

meta.xref: DES s20, HC r239, HC p151

config.text: What should you do when you leave your car unattended for a few minutes?

choices.label: Switch the engine off but leave the key in
Lock it and remove the key

correct.text: Always switch off the engine, remove the key and lock your car, even if you're only leaving it for a few minutes.

incorrect.text: Always switch off the engine, remove the key and lock your car, even if you're only leaving it for a few minutes.

config.text: Why is it important to wear suitable shoes when you're driving?

choices.label: To prevent wear on the pedals
To maintain control of the pedals
To enable you to adjust your seat
To enable you to walk for assistance if you break down

correct.text:
When you’re going to drive, make sure that you’re wearing suitable clothing.
Comfortable shoes will ensure that you have proper control of the foot pedals.

incorrect.text:
When you’re going to drive, make sure that you’re wearing suitable clothing.
Comfortable shoes will ensure that you have proper control of the foot pedals.

config.text: What can be damaged if you turn the steering wheel when the car isn't moving?

correct.text: Turning the steering wheel when the car isn't moving is known as dry steering. It can cause unnecessary wear to the tyres and steering mechanism.

incorrect.text: Turning the steering wheel when the car isn't moving is known as dry steering. It can cause unnecessary wear to the tyres and steering mechanism.

config.text: If you're involved in a collision, what will reduce the risk of neck injury?

correct.text: If you’re involved in a collision, head restraints will reduce the risk of neck injury. They must be properly adjusted. Make sure they aren’t positioned too low: in a crash, this could cause damage to the neck.

incorrect.text: If you’re involved in a collision, head restraints will reduce the risk of neck injury. They must be properly adjusted. Make sure they aren’t positioned too low: in a crash, this could cause damage to the neck.

config.text: What can you expect if you drive using rapid acceleration and heavy braking?

correct.text: Using the controls smoothly can reduce fuel consumption by about 15%, as well as reducing wear and tear on your vehicle. Plan ahead and anticipate changes of speed well in advance. This will reduce the need to accelerate rapidly or brake sharply.

incorrect.text: Using the controls smoothly can reduce fuel consumption by about 15%, as well as reducing wear and tear on your vehicle. Plan ahead and anticipate changes of speed well in advance. This will reduce the need to accelerate rapidly or brake sharply.

config.text: What can you achieve if you drive smoothly?

choices.label: Reduction in journey times by about 15%
Increase in fuel consumption by about 15%
Reduction in fuel consumption by about 15%
Increase in journey times by about 15%

correct.text: By driving smoothly, you'll not only save about 15% of your fuel but will also reduce the amount of wear and tear on your vehicle and the level of pollution it produces. You're also likely to feel more relaxed and have a more pleasant journey.

incorrect.text: By driving smoothly, you'll not only save about 15% of your fuel but will also reduce the amount of wear and tear on your vehicle and the level of pollution it produces. You're also likely to feel more relaxed and have a more pleasant journey.

config.text: How can you reduce the damage your vehicle causes to the environment?

correct.text: By looking well ahead and recognising hazards in good time, you can avoid late and heavy braking. Watch the traffic flow and look well ahead for potential hazards so you can control your speed in good time. Avoid over-revving the engine and accelerating harshly, as this increases wear to the engine and uses more fuel.

incorrect.text: By looking well ahead and recognising hazards in good time, you can avoid late and heavy braking. Watch the traffic flow and look well ahead for potential hazards so you can control your speed in good time. Avoid over-revving the engine and accelerating harshly, as this increases wear to the engine and uses more fuel.

config.text: Why is it a good idea to plan your journey to avoid busy times?

choices.label: You'll have a more stressful journey
Your journey time will be longer
It will cause more traffic congestion

correct.text: No-one likes to spend time in traffic queues. Try to avoid busy times related to school or work travel.

incorrect.text: No-one likes to spend time in traffic queues. Try to avoid busy times related to school or work travel.

config.text: What should you remove from your car before leaving it unattended?

correct.text: Never leave the vehicle registration document inside your car. This document would help a thief to dispose of your car more easily.

incorrect.text: Never leave the vehicle registration document inside your car. This document would help a thief to dispose of your car more easily.

config.text: What's the purpose of road humps, chicanes and narrowings?

correct.text: Traffic-calming measures help to keep vehicle speeds low in congested areas where there are pedestrians and children. A pedestrian is much more likely to survive a collision with a vehicle travelling at 20 mph than they are with a vehicle travelling at 40 mph.

incorrect.text: Traffic-calming measures help to keep vehicle speeds low in congested areas where there are pedestrians and children. A pedestrian is much more likely to survive a collision with a vehicle travelling at 20 mph than they are with a vehicle travelling at 40 mph.

config.text: You're stopped at the side of the road. What must you do if you'll be waiting there for some time?

correct.text: If your vehicle is stationary and is likely to remain so for some time, you must switch off the engine unless you're stationary in traffic or diagnosing a fault.

incorrect.text: If your vehicle is stationary and is likely to remain so for some time, you must switch off the engine unless you're stationary in traffic or diagnosing a fault.

config.text: Which driving technique can help you save fuel?

choices.label: Using lower gears as often as possible

correct.text: Missing out intermediate gears, when appropriate, helps to reduce the amount of time spent accelerating and decelerating - the times when your vehicle uses the most fuel.

incorrect.text: Missing out intermediate gears, when appropriate, helps to reduce the amount of time spent accelerating and decelerating - the times when your vehicle uses the most fuel.

config.text: What makes your tyres illegal?

choices.label: If they have any large, deep cuts in the side wall
If they have different tread patterns

correct.text: Your tyres may be of different treads and makes. They can even be second-hand, as long as they're in good condition. They must, however, be intact, without cuts or tears. When checking the side walls for cuts and bulges, don't forget to check the side of the tyre that's hidden from view, under the car.

incorrect.text: Your tyres may be of different treads and makes. They can even be second-hand, as long as they're in good condition. They must, however, be intact, without cuts or tears. When checking the side walls for cuts and bulges, don't forget to check the side of the tyre that's hidden from view, under the car.

config.text: How can you plan your route before starting a long journey?

choices.label: Use a route planner on the internet

correct.text: Various route planners are available on the internet. Most of them give you several options, allowing you to choose between the most direct route and quieter roads. They may also identify rest and fuel stops. Print off the directions and take them with you.

incorrect.text: Various route planners are available on the internet. Most of them give you several options, allowing you to choose between the most direct route and quieter roads. They may also identify rest and fuel stops. Print off the directions and take them with you.

config.text: What makes the vehicle in the picture 'environmentally friendly'?

correct.text: Trams are powered by electricity and therefore don't emit exhaust fumes. They ease traffic congestion by offering drivers an alternative to using their car, particularly in busy cities and towns.

incorrect.text: Trams are powered by electricity and therefore don't emit exhaust fumes. They ease traffic congestion by offering drivers an alternative to using their car, particularly in busy cities and towns.

config.text: Where would parking your vehicle cause an obstruction?

choices.label: In front of a property entrance

correct.text: Don’t park your vehicle where it may obstruct access to a business or property. Think carefully before you slow down and stop. Look at road markings and signs to ensure that you aren’t parking illegally.

incorrect.text: Don’t park your vehicle where it may obstruct access to a business or property. Think carefully before you slow down and stop. Look at road markings and signs to ensure that you aren’t parking illegally.

config.text: When should tyre pressures be checked?

correct.text: Check the tyre pressures when the tyres are cold. This will give you a more accurate reading. The heat generated on a long journey will raise the pressure inside the tyre.

incorrect.text: Check the tyre pressures when the tyres are cold. This will give you a more accurate reading. The heat generated on a long journey will raise the pressure inside the tyre.

config.text: What part of the car does the law require you to keep in good condition?

correct.text: Unless exempt, you and your passengers must wear a seat belt (or suitable child restraint). The seat belts in your car must be in good condition and working properly; they'll be checked during its MOT test.

incorrect.text: Unless exempt, you and your passengers must wear a seat belt (or suitable child restraint). The seat belts in your car must be in good condition and working properly; they'll be checked during its MOT test.

config.text: How can drivers help the environment?

correct.text:
Rapid acceleration and heavy braking lead to increased
  • fuel consumption
  • wear on your vehicle.
Having your vehicle serviced regularly will maintain its efficiency, produce cleaner emissions and reduce the risk of a breakdown.

incorrect.text:
Rapid acceleration and heavy braking lead to increased
  • fuel consumption
  • wear on your vehicle.
Having your vehicle serviced regularly will maintain its efficiency, produce cleaner emissions and reduce the risk of a breakdown.

config.text: What's the legal minimum depth of tread for car tyres?

correct.text: Car tyres must have sufficient depth of tread to give them a good grip on the road surface. The legal minimum for cars is 1.6 mm. This depth should be across the central three-quarters of the breadth of the tyre and around the entire circumference.

incorrect.text: Car tyres must have sufficient depth of tread to give them a good grip on the road surface. The legal minimum for cars is 1.6 mm. This depth should be across the central three-quarters of the breadth of the tyre and around the entire circumference.

config.text: How can you avoid wasting fuel?

choices.label: By having your vehicle serviced regularly
By revving the engine in the lower gears
By keeping an empty roof rack on your vehicle
By driving at higher speeds where possible

correct.text: If you don't have your vehicle serviced regularly, the engine will gradually become less efficient. This will cause increased fuel consumption and, in turn, an increase in the amount of harmful emissions it produces.

incorrect.text: If you don't have your vehicle serviced regularly, the engine will gradually become less efficient. This will cause increased fuel consumption and, in turn, an increase in the amount of harmful emissions it produces.

config.text: Why have 'red routes' been introduced in major cities?

choices.label: To allow lorries to load more freely

correct.text: Inconsiderate parking can obstruct the flow of traffic and so make traffic congestion worse. Red routes are designed to prevent this by enforcing strict parking restrictions. Driving slowly in traffic increases fuel consumption and causes a build-up of exhaust fumes.

incorrect.text: Inconsiderate parking can obstruct the flow of traffic and so make traffic congestion worse. Red routes are designed to prevent this by enforcing strict parking restrictions. Driving slowly in traffic increases fuel consumption and causes a build-up of exhaust fumes.
